column14: en_notes
column15: en_marker

column8: Que causa perturbação ou inquietação; inquietante.
column14: Unforgettable and deeply evocative, often producing an emotional or eerie impression.
column15: A haunting film which stayed with me long after I left the cinema.

column8: Que provoca emoção ou comoção; emocionante.
column14: Causing strong feelings of sadness, sympathy, or admiration.
column15: A wonderful story. So moving I cried!

column8: Que atrai, encanta ou prende a atenção.
column14: Extremely interesting and exciting, holding your attention tightly.
column15: Such a gripping plot. I was on the edge of my seat all the way through.

column8: Que desperta emoção ou sentimento profundo.
column14: Producing feelings of happiness and affection.
column15: It was a heart-warming story which restored my faith in human nature.

column8: Que tem movimento ou energia; ativo.
column14: With a quick pace, often full of action or events.
column15: A fast-moving story which jumps from past to present and back again at breakneck speed.

column8: Que desperta curiosidade ou mistério; misterioso.
column14: Interesting because it is unusual or mysterious.
column15: The plot was intriguing, I really couldn't predict how it would end.

column8: Que incentiva, motiva ou estimula.
column14: Making you think deeply about a subject or issue.
column15: A thought-provoking documentary that raised many interesting questions.

column8: Que provoca medo ou susto; aterrorizante.
column14: Causing an unpleasant feeling of fear or unease.
column15: A ghostly atmosphere and strange goings-on. This film was just too creepy for me.

column8: De difícil digestão emocional; opressivo.
column14: Difficult to read or understand due to its complexity or style.
column15: Rather heavy-going I really had to make an effort to finish it.

column8: Difícil de acreditar; pouco provável.
column14: Not seeming reasonable or probable.
column15: The characters were totally implausible, I couldn't take any of them seriously.

column8: Ambiente que evoca fantasmas ou assombrações.
column14: A setting or mood that feels eerie or supernatural.
column15: A ghostly atmosphere and strange goings-on. This film was just too creepy for me.

column8: Eventos fora do comum; incomuns ou bizarros.
column14: Unusual or unexplained events or occurrences.
column15: A ghostly atmosphere and strange goings-on. This film was just too creepy for me.

column8: O texto que descreve as cenas de um filme; guião.
column14: The written script of a film, including dialogue and instructions for actors and crew.

column8: A transposição de uma obra literária para o cinema.
column14: The conversion of a book or other source material into a movie.

column8: A sucessão de momentos em uma narrativa ou filme.
column14: The control of when something happens, often crucial in storytelling or performances.

column8: Cenas importantes ou determinantes em um filme ou livro.
column14: Important or pivotal moments in a film or book.

column8: Pessoa que aprecia o cinema profundamente; amante do cinema.
column14: A person who frequently attends the cinema.

column8: Indivíduo que gosta ou aprecia filmes.
column14: A person with a passionate interest in films and filmmaking.

column8: O assunto principal de um livro ou filme.
column14: The central idea or underlying message in a story or film.

column8: Figura fictícia ou real representada em uma narrativa.
column14: A person, animal, or entity portrayed in a story or film.

column8: Parte ou segmento de uma obra cinematográfica ou teatral.
column14: A single piece of action or event in a film or play.

column8: Conjunto de atores que participam de uma peça, filme ou série.
column14: The process of selecting actors for specific roles in a film or play.

column8: Forma de contar ou apresentar uma história.
column14: A spoken or written account of connected events; a story.

column8: Técnicas para criar ilusões visuais ou sonoras em filmes.
column14: Visual or sound effects created artificially for a film.

column8: O diretor ou criador de filmes.
column14: A person who directs or produces films.

column8: A sequência de eventos ou ações em uma história.
column14: The sequence of events that form the main story in a book, film, or play.

column8: Troca de falas entre personagens em um filme ou livro.
column14: Conversations between characters in a film, play, or book.

column8: Pessoa que avalia ou comenta obras artísticas.
column14: A person who evaluates and reviews artistic works, such as films or books.

column8: Conjunto de espectadores ou audiência de uma obra.
column14: The group of people who watch a film, play, or performance.

column8: A ambientação visual de uma cena ou narrativa.
column14: The time and place in which the events of a film or book occur.

column8: Que é intenso, claro ou cheio de vida.
column14: Producing strong, clear images or memories.

column8: Relativo a drama ou a situações intensas.
column14: Relating to drama or creating a strong emotional impact.

column8: Lugar onde se exibem filmes; a arte cinematográfica.
column14: A place where films are shown, also known as a movie theater.

column8: Relato de eventos verídicos.
column14: A narrative based on real events and people.

column8: Plano ou texto que detalha a sequência de cenas de um filme ou peça teatral.
column14: The written text of a play, film, or broadcast.

column8: Que carece de variação; repetitivo ou aborrecido.
column14: Not interesting or exciting; boring.

column8: Fazer uma reserva para entradas em eventos ou cinema.
column14: To reserve seats for a film, play, or event.

column8: Pessoa que demonstra entusiasmo ou grande interesse por algo.
column14: (from Spanish) sb who likes a particular sport, activity, or subject very much and knows a lot
column15: She’s a real aficionado of Italian opera – she knows a lot about it and goes whenever she can.
column21: A person who is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about a particular activity.

column8: Grande onda marítima causada por movimentos sísmicos no fundo do mar.
column14: (from Japanese) an extremely large wave often caused by an earthquake
column15: After the earthquake, there was a tsunami warning, but luckily, it didn’t happen.
column21: A large, powerful sea wave caused by an underwater earthquake or volcanic eruption.

column8: Erro ou deslize que pode causar embaraço ou desconforto social.
column14: (from French) an action or remark that causes embarrassment because it is not socially correct
column15: I made a real faux pas when I mentioned to our boss that Sam had been asked to leave his previous job.
column21: An embarrassing or tactless act or remark in a social situation.

column8: Expressão italiana que descreve o ponto ideal de cozedura da massa, firme ao morder.
column14: (from Italian) not too soft, still with a perfect bite
column15: Don’t overcook the pasta – just until it’s al dente.
column21: Describes pasta cooked to be firm to the bite.

column8: Idéia ou expressão muito usada, que perdeu a originalidade.
column14: (from French) a phrase or an idea that has been used so often that it no longer has meaning and is not interesting
column15: It might be a bit of a cliché, but I think it’s actually true that ‘opposites attract’.
column21: An overused expression or idea that lacks originality.

column8: Prazer obtido com o infortúnio de outra pessoa; palavra de origem alemã.
column14: (from German) a feeling of pleasure at the bad things which happen to other people
column15: I’m afraid I felt a certain schadenfreude when my ex-husband told me his girlfriend had left him.
column21: Pleasure derived from another person’s misfortune.

column8: Sensação de já ter vivenciado algo que está ocorrendo no presente.
column14: (from French) the feeling that you have experienced sth before.
column15: When we were introduced, I had a sense of déjà vu, even though I knew we had never met before.
column21: The feeling that you have already experienced a current situation.

column8: Desastre ou colapso total, especialmente em situações financeiras ou políticas.
column14: (from French) an event or situation that is a complete failure and causes embarrassment
column15: Their business venture ended in a complete debacle and the manager resigned.
column21: A complete and utter failure or disaster.
